= Notes and techniques on python=

== Regular Expression ==

Notes from the  [Interactive regular expression](https://regexone.com/)

1. *abc* for matching letters 
2. *123* for digits
3. *\d* : any digit
4. *\D*: Non digits
5. *.* : any  character
6. *\.* : Period to specify the dot character
7. *[slice]*: match a set like [a-c] match a ,b and c
8. *[^slice]: note the element on the  slice 
9. *[slice, slice]*: Multiple slices could be specified separated by comma
10. $\w$: alpha numeric character
11. *chara{3}*: for catching repetitions
12. *\** : Zero or more character
13. *+* : One or more character
14. *?* : Optional character
15. $\s$: any white space
16. *^*: Match the start of the line
17. *$* : Match the end of the line
18. *(...)*  : To capture a group
19. *(..(..) )* : To capture subgroups
